text:
YULIYA KLOCHAN: I'm
doing very well.
I'm very excited.

INTERVIEWER: Are you
excited, nervous?

YULIYA KLOCHAN: Yeah,
I'm very excited.

It's my first red
carpet premier,
which is what I think it is.

INTERVIEWER: What was the
hardest thing about this class?

YULIYA KLOCHAN: The
beginning was difficult

because there was a lot
of work you had to do,

and for me it kind of made
me realize what I know
and don't know.

So just getting rid of
all the misconceptions

I had about filmmaking,
script writing,
and all else was difficult.

INTERVIEWER: Do you feel like
you want to keep doing this,

or are you going to try to
take the things in the class
and apply it to non-video stuff?

YULIYA KLOCHAN: I'm
definitely interested
in educational resources.

So video, I think, is
one of the best mediums

to convey excitement about
science and mathematics.

So this is definitely something
that will be important in life.
INTERVIEWER: [INAUDIBLE].

[LAUGHTER] How would
you describe this class

to someone who's
never taken it before?

YULIYA KLOCHAN: You
have a month to learn

how to make an
educational video,

and then you get to write,
produce, direct, and create it
all.

INTERVIEWER: Any words
of advice for people
who have never done it before?

YULIYA KLOCHAN: Don't think
it's going to be easy.

Just always think
that it's going
to be harder than you expected.
And put work into it.

INTERVIEWER: Thank
you very much.
YULIYA KLOCHAN: Thank you.
